pageContent: LOGINLOGOUTHELPPrinter FriendlyPageEarthfiles, news category.Share:DiggFacebookStumbleUpon2-Stage Cannings Cross Wheat Formation Scene of Farm Arrest © 2009 by Linda Moulton HoweCannings Cross, Wiltshire, crop formation has evolved through farmer damage from June27, 2009, to mysterious July 10, 2009, second stage reconstruction to July 13, 2009, arrestof farm employee with shot gun. Part 1 of Cannings Cross near Allington, Wiltshire, England,showing June 27, 2009, first reported pattern after the angry farmer drovehis tractor around in circles cutting off the points of the interior pattern.Aerial image © 2009 by Eva-Marie Brekkestø.Photoshop reconstruction of formationto illustrate pattern before the farmer drovearound in circles cutting off the inner points.Electronic reconstruction © 2009 by Psycho Clown.Part 2 of Cannings Cross near Allington, Wiltshire,England, reported on July 10, 2009,with additional circles at the outer points. Inside the farmer'soriginal June 27th circles of wheat cut down, the cut off interiorpoints have been reconstructed into fresh, new points.Aerial image © 2009 by Olivier Morel (WCCSG).For other images and information: Cropcircleconnector. July 4, 2009 Cannings Cross near Allington, Wiltshire County, England - TheCannings Cross wheat pattern near Allington, Wiltshire, England, has been evolvingthrough great confusion. The farm owner originally took his tractor into the first part of theformation reported on June 27, 2009, and drove in big circles to cut down the interior

points of the pattern. Eva-Marie Brekkestø flew over the pattern after the farmer'sdestruction and took the first aerial photograph. A computer graphics artist north ofWiltshire known as Psycho Clown then volunteered to reconstruct what the formationlooked like before the farmer's tractor destruction and produced a Photoshopreconstruction.Then on July 10, the formation evolved into a second part with more circles added to theoutside points and the damaged interior points were reconstructed into fresh points.By the night of July 12 to 13, the angry farm owner apparently hired a man to walk thefield with a gun and shoot any “croppies” that entered. Then yesterday afternoon, July 13,2009, the Wiltshire Police arrested either the hired man or the farmer allegedly for firing ashot gun. The news was carried in the July 14, 2009, edition of the Gazette & Herald.Tuesday, July 14, 2009, Gazette & Herald, Wiltshire, England.This morning, July 14, 2009, I also received the following communication from PsychoClown and report it here for more clarity. As this story continues to unfold, Earthfiles willreport follow ups on the police arrest and any more additions or changes to the Allingtonformation.From: thepsychoclownSubject: Re: From Linda Moulton Howe inquiry, July 14, 2009Date: July 14, 2009 11:03:35 AM MDTTo: earthfiles@earthfiles.comHi LindaThe formation was reported first on June 27th, and before anyone could get inthe air to photograph it, the farmer took his mower to it and partially destroyedit. I have attached the original photo taken by Eva-Marie Brekkestø in it'sunaltered state, this file is called “gfdre.jpg.” [ after the farmer drove aroundthe circle cutting off the inner formation points.]Part 1 of Cannings Cross wheat formation near Allington, Wiltshire, England,first reported June 27, 2009. Then the farmer took his tractor and cut down the formation wherethe round rings of destruction are between outer points and inner points.Aerial image © 2009 by Eva-Marie Brekkestø.I have also attached my reconstructed (Photoshopped) version that I posted on

the Crop Circle Connector Forum and was then subsequently transferred tothe CCC page relating to the Cannings Cross formation, this file is called“canningscross2009.jpg.”Photoshop reconstruction of formation to illustrate pattern before the farmer drovearound in circles cutting off the inner points. Electronic reconstruction © 2009 by PsychoClown.Then on Friday, July 10th, the formation was reported again to have extendedwith extra grape shots and neatened back up.Part 2 of Cannings Cross near Allington, Wiltshire, England, reported on July 10, 2009,with additional circles at the outer points. Inside the farmer's original June 27th circles of wheatcut down, the cut off interior points have been reconstructed into fresh, new points.Aerial image © 2009 by Olivier Morel (WCCSG).The latest events are quite bizarre (the farmer was arrested yesterday forbrandishing a gun at police and passers by.Hope this helps.Psycho ClownPS: I don't usually use my real name. It's for no other reason than usually I liketo keep myself to myself, hope you understand. Thanks.
